bio_short: Brady Ellison is a five-time Olympian from the USA who competes with a recurve bow and is regarded as one of the most successful archers of all time. Nicknamed "The Arizona Cowboy," he was the first American to hold the world No. 1 ranking, a title he has reclaimed multiple times.
bio_long: Ellison is a multiple Olympic medallist, including team silver at London 2012 and Rio 2016, individual bronze at Rio, and individual silver and mixed team bronze at Paris 2024. He is the 2019 World Archery Champion, a three-time World Archery Field Champion, and the only male archer to win six Archery World Cup Finals. His 2019 season—featuring a world title, a world record score of 702, and another World Cup Final win—is considered one of the greatest in archery history.
quote_text: Archery is not just sport for me. Archery is truly my life.

bio_short: Mathias Fullerton is a Danish compound archer who has rapidly risen to prominence in international competition. A standout since his cadet years, he captured team silver at the 2019 World Archery Youth Championships, then individual silver at the 2021 European Archery Championships in Antalya. In 2023, he claimed team gold at the World Archery Youth Championships and team silver at both the World Archery Championships and European Games. The following year, Fullerton triumphed at the prestigious Vegas Shoot, secured team gold at the European Indoor Archery Championships, and earned individual gold plus team bronze at the European Archery Championships in Essen. Known for his composure and precision under pressure, he continues shaping Denmark's archery future.
quote_text: Mostly what's changed is that I now strive a lot more to perform, rather than fearing to fail.

bio_short: Born in Istanbul in 1999, Mete Gazoz was destined to be an archer. His father is a former national-level competitive archer, while his mother is the president of the Istanbul Archery Club. Becoming an archer in family immersed in the sport is one thing, but becoming a record-breaking bowman is something else, but since Mete first picked up a bow to begin practicing in 2010 he seems to have been on the fast-track to the very pinnacle of the sport.
bio_long: The right-handed recurve bow shooter first dipped his toes into the waters of international competition in 2013 and won his first of many international medals the very same year when he was part of the when he was part of the silver medal-winning Turkish team at the 2013 World Youth Archery Championship. A year later he claimed silver at the 2014 Youth Olympic Games in China. Just two years later he was competing for Türkiye on the full Olympic stage in Rio 2016.
quote_text: I'm the hunter, not the prey.

bio_short: Ella Gibson is a British international compound archer who has become one of the sport's most dominant figures. A World Games, European Outdoor, and Indoor champion, she made her senior debut in 2019 after winning mixed team bronze at the World Archery Youth Championships. Her breakthrough came in 2021 with individual silver at the European Championships in Türkiye
bio_long: The following year she captured her first major title at the European Indoor Championships, swept all three Hyundai Archery World Cup stages she entered, and claimed World Games gold in Alabama. Her success carried into 2023 with silver at the European Games and two bronzes at the World Archery Field Championships. In 2024 she was crowned European Champion in Essen, Germany. By 2025, Gibson had celebrated an extraordinary 1,000 days ranked as the world number one.
quote_text: I want to be the best in the world. Full stop. I don't want to be in the top five forever, I want to be number one.

bio_short: Deepika Kumari is India's most decorated archer, a four-time Olympian and two-time World Archery Championships silver medallist. Rising to world No. 1, she became the first Indian to win the cadet world title in 2009 at just 15, later claiming the junior world crown in 2011. Her senior debut came in 2010 with team bronze at the Asian Games, followed by team silver at the 2011 Worlds. The only female Indian archer to compete at four Olympic Games, injuries hampered her early campaigns in London 2012 and Rio 2016, but she advanced to the quarterfinals at Tokyo 2020 and Paris 2024. A five-time Archery World Cup Final silver medallist, she also won bronze in 2018. Off the field, Deepika married fellow archer Atanu Das in 2020, and they welcomed their daughter Vedika in 2022.
quote_text: In archery, it's 95 percent mental. It is the same bow and arrow, the same target and the same drill. We know we have the ability.

bio_short: Sara Lopez is an international compound archer from Colombia and the most decorated female archer of all time. The first and only athlete to win the Hyundai Archery World Cup Final six times, she extended her tally to nine titles, redefining women's compound archery. Lopez has broken every major world record and spent more time ranked world number one than any female archer in the World Cup era. In 2021 she won an impressive triple gold—individual, team, and mixed team—at the World Archery Championships.
bio_long: Debuting internationally at 18, she claimed youth and senior world titles in the same season and has collected major medals every year since. Honoured in her hometown with a field in her name and the Orden de la Democracia Simon Bolivar, Lopez continues to inspire athletes worldwide.
quote_text: That desire to win is what differentiates me ... I want to be the best and I work for it.

bio_short: Mike Schloesser, known as "Mister Perfect" after becoming the first archer to score a perfect 600 in the 18-metre indoor round in 2015, is one of the most successful compound archers in history. A World Archery Champion at just 19, he has since become the longest-standing world number one (as of March 2024) and the first compound man to win the Archery World Cup Final four times (2016, 2020, 2021, 2022). He has also claimed the rare "triple crown" of world titles in target, indoor, and field archery.
bio_long: Despite early battles with confidence, Schloesser has built a reputation for focus under pressure, earning four world titles, four World Cup Final trophies, six European titles, and a European Games gold. Off the field, he shares his passion with wife and fellow Olympian Gaby Schloesser, and in 2025 they welcomed their daughter, Luna.
quote_text: I shoot one arrow at a time, many times a day, and those arrows add up.

bio_short: Lim Sihyeon is a Korean recurve archer whose extraordinary achievements have cemented her as one of the sport's brightest stars. On her Olympic debut at Paris 2024, she won three gold medals—individual, team, and mixed team—joining an elite group of only three archers ever to achieve such a feat at a single Games, and securing Korea's historic 10th consecutive Olympic team title. She also set a new Olympic and world record in the ranking round.
bio_long:
Her meteoric rise began just a year earlier at her first Hyundai Archery World Cup in Shanghai (2023), where she claimed both individual and team gold. Over the season, she collected 10 additional circuit medals across all disciplines, underlining her dominance. That same year, she swept the Asian Games in Hangzhou with three gold medals, and followed with further success at the Asian Archery Championships, winning team and mixed team gold along with individual silver.
Lim's rapid ascent—from international debut to Olympic triple champion in just two seasons—has established her as arguably the most successful rookie in archery history.
quote_text: What's more important than shooting lots of arrows? Mental strength.

bio_short: Kim Woojin is a Korean recurve archer and the most successful Olympic archer in history with five gold medals. He is the only male archer to win three golds at a single Games, achieving the feat at Paris 2024 where he also claimed his first individual Olympic title.
bio_long:
Woojin first made history in 2011 as the youngest men's World Archery Champion and went on to secure two more world titles in 2015 and 2021. He has also won two Asian Games golds and a record five World Cup Final trophies. Known for his consistency and composure, Brady Ellison once called him "the greatest of all time."
Off the range, Woojin enjoys golf, hiking, and family life with his wife Minji and their son, born in 2022.
quote_text: I think you can now call me the greatest of all time.
